page.title: 08Chestnut Industry Matfield
page.content: Several of our areas of woodland are {Sweet Chestnuts grown for their wood which is hard and very durable.Sold by the standing acre they are{coppiced} every 11_12 years (18 for hop poles) producing smooth, straight timber. Forwards,a family concern, prepare chestnut in Petteridge for fencing and farm use. From November to the end of March 10_12 acres of chestnut are cut. The chestnut is sawn off at ground level, trimmed,cut into lengths and brought to the yard. Posts to be set in the ground are stood in boiling creosote to preserve them,very straight pieces are selected for splitting in half for diamond fencing,others are split into even sized palings to be made into fencing. To retain their strength pales must be cleft or split,not sawn.{4 people}work all year with{one extra}for cutting.
